docs.abstract: P Wyden book on 'overweight soc' in US revd
docs.lead_paragraph: ACCORDING to a poll taken for the makers of Metrecal, 79 million Americans were overweight in 1964, 52 million were at least conscious of the fact, and about 9 million were trying to reduce. The other 27 million fatties either did not know anything was the matter with them, or didn't care.
